entry.title: Paleo environments and modeling
entry.content:

entry.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

link.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

entry.content:
On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particular the global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.

Day schedule

9:00-10:00, The global C cycle and 14C | Susan Trumbore

10:00-10:30, Coffee break

10:30-11:30, Radiocarbon nomenclature | Xiaomei Xu

11:30-12:30, Conventional dating | Axel Steinhof

12:30-13:30, Lunch break

13:30-14:00, Problem set 1 | Susan Trumbore

14:00-15:00, Tree rings and radiocarbon | Lukas Wacker

15:00-15:30, Coffee break

15:30-17:00, Practial lab | Axel Steinhof, Jan Muhr, Valerie Schwab, Susan Trumbore
entry.summary: On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particular the global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.
